geneSummary: CTNNB1 (β-catenin), a transcriptional activator, is recurrently mutated in various cancers including endometrial and hepatocellular cancers.

mutationEffect.description: The CTNNB1 S45F mutation is located in the N-terminus of the protein. This mutation has been found in melanoma (PMID: 25148578, 24265153). Expression of this mutation in a liver and desmoid cancer cell line demonstrated that it is activating as measured by increased protein activity and nuclear accumulation compared to wildtype (PMID: 26686699, 18282277).

variantSummary: The CTNNB1 S45F mutation is likely oncogenic.
